resources.string: There are two ways of solving this using Frida. \nDont overthink it, try google attacks relating to PIN codes.
Congratulations on completing the challenge! \n There are two ways of completing this challenge, one by using brute force, and another by hooking and modifying the return value. \n Try them both out!

You\'ve exposed the secret activity. Developers need to take care when declaring android components such as activities as being exported otherwise any application can interact with said components. If it is necessary to export a component then it should declare what other application can call it. Always investigate exported components when testing an application.
This challenge isn\'t actually related to this screen and can be exploited at any point in the application!
Think about what an android application can export.
ADB has an built in activity manager!
To root or not too root

The challenge is to be able to read this very description while having root access on your device!

 There are no fancy detection methods being done in this app, just generic libs.

 If you're here with root access then congrats you made it!
The broadcast occurs every time this fragment is opened from the menu and when you click the send button!
Broadcasts can easily be sniffed by other applications and thus should always be checked for sensitive information when testing an application!
The webview below takes in and reflects input from the textbox, try do something fun with this!\n (Note there\'s no flag or success screen for this)
Maybe some malicious input could be reflected here?
The objective here is to perform XSS in the webview!\n If you\'ve done this then congrats you\'ve completed the challenge!
